g.text: compute and store a state update
to local Proof Server or over TLS to a remote, TEE-equipped one
store pending private data indexed by tx
now we have all the data needed to ask user for authorization
though in practice0 2-stage process is usually in place:
- first dApp asks if can interact with wallet at all(and user confirms or rejects)
- then wallet asks user for each separate transaction
alternative flow: user pre-authorizes to avoid this step.
Depending on time it takes to calculate SC ZK-proofs (steps 4, 5)
the user experience may require moving user authorization step earlier
to local Proof Server or over TLS to a remote, TEE-equipped one
assemble tx 'call' from call tx and spend tx
time passes as TX is verified and propageted
verified tx and new public state
time passes until Wallet Front End polls Indexer or user opens browser
